roleset.name: rotation, motion in a new direction

example.name: turn-v: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: These served as money charms for shops , whose owners would turn them facing outward in the morning so as to attract wealth inside .

propbank.arg: so as to attract wealth inside

example.name: turn-v: ergative
example.text: The focus turned to other fixed - income markets .

example.name: turn-v: non-obvious direction
example.text: The reforms turned the economy around .

example.name: take_turn-l: light verb
example.text: The soldiers had been taken to the station after apparently inadvertently taking a wrong turn .

example.name: downturn-n: metaphorical motion with DIR
example.text: As the global economy enters a down - turn ...

example.name: turn-n: more metaphorical motion
example.text: retired Justice Lewis Powell contested the notion that the last Supreme Court term marked a turn toward conservatism

example.name: turn-n: clear-cut physical motion. Both args
example.text: It was all in his turn of the wrist .

example.name: turning-n: remember VPs are PRD.
example.text: involuntary turning of her head to the right associated with worsening neck pain

example.name: turning-n: arg 0
example.text: My turning of the key in the lock alerted him

roleset.note: TURN NOTES: Updated for SpatialAMR (pragmatic arg2 added).
TURN-V NOTES: Member of VNcls crane-40.3.2, hurt-40.8.3-1-1, meander-47.7, roll-51.3.1. Checked by Julia, 11/2010. (from turn.01-v)
TURN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on turn-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls crane-40.3.2, hurt-40.8.3-1-1, meander-47.7, roll-51.3.1. (from turn.01-n)

TURNING-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to turn.01-v and turn.01-n. Turn.01-v is a member of VN classes crane-40.3.2, hurt-40.8.3, meander-47.7, and roll-51.3.1. Framed by Katie. (from turning.01-n)
Watch out for light verbs! (from turn.01-n) Watch out for light verbs. (from turning.01-n)

roleset.name: transformation, becoming

example.name: turn-v: transitive
example.text: The plan turned state companies private .

example.name: turn-v: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: If you want to avoid going to all this trouble , you might instead consult the traditional Chinese farmers ' almanac , which suggests that during bad times people can turn their fortunes by repositioning their water coolers or hot water dispensers .

propbank.arg: by repositioning their water coolers or hot water dispensers

example.name: turn-v: ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: And a child who is free to make his own choices does n't automatically turn into a delinquent .

propbank.arg: a child who is free to make his own choices

example.name: turn-n: args 1 and 3
example.text: With the turn for the better in his father 's political circumstances , Ye Daying left behind his violent life and changed suddenly , becoming more inward - looking .

example.name: turn-n: turn of events
example.text: If this strikes you as an extraordinary turn of events , well it strikes many overseas as nearly unbelievable .

example.name: turn-n: all args
example.text: Hannah Arendt and Her Turn From Political Journalist To Political Philosopher

example.name: turn-n: all args
example.text: It was the turn of the season from autumn to winter

roleset.note: TURN-V NOTES: Member of Vncls convert-26.6.2, turn-26.6.1-1. (from turn.02-v)
TURN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on turn-v.02. Corresponds to Vncls convert-26.6.2, turn-26.6.1. (from turn.02-n)
Watch out for light verbs! Also, arg0 is being left off because it is not clear that it can occur in nominal usages. If you see one, call it arg0 and send it in. (from turn.02-n)

roleset.name: idiomatic: turn thumbs down on = reject

example.name: turn-v: this really does occur
example.text: The voters turned thumbs down on the proposed bill .

roleset.note: TURN-V NOTES: (from turn.03-v)

roleset.name: depend, hang, hinge

example.name: turn-v
example.text: Instead , it turns on the disputed and elusive facts of `` who did what to whom . ''

propbank.arg: on the disputed and elusive facts of `` who did what to whom . ''

roleset.note: TURN-V NOTES: No Vncls. (from turn.14-v)

roleset.name: produce, nonphrasal

example.name: turn-v: turn a prophet?
example.text: Why should they have to co - exist with opportunists rushing in to turn a quick profit ?

roleset.note: TURN-V NOTES: (from turn.16-v)

roleset.name: turn 'one's back' or 'a blind eye': ignore purposefully

example.name: turn-v: Typical usage, all args
example.text: It is to the great , abiding shame of women and blacks PRO to turn their backs on the great achievements of these people .

propbank.arg: the great achievements of these people

example.name: turn-v: a blind eye
example.text: In fact , Japan is an island country , it has abundant tides and wind power generation resources , and the solar energy is also very advanced . However , they turn a blind eye to these advantages , having put their whole hearts to develop nuclear power over the past years .

propbank.arg: having put their whole hearts to develop nuclear power over the past years

roleset.note: TURN-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT phase 1. (from turn.18-v)

roleset.name: reject

example.name: turn_away-v: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Kelly Siegler , an assistant district attorney who was in the courtroom , disputed suggestions the action was sexist , saying she had seen Judge Hancock turn away male defendants dressed in shorts , tank tops or muscle shirts `` many times . ''

propbank.arg: male defendants dressed in shorts , tank tops or muscle shirts `` many times

example.name: turn_away-v: ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: Yesterday Ehud Barak won the endorsement of his Labor Party as its candidate for Prime Minister and while his supporters may be cheering , many other Israelis have turned away from the man they elected just 18 months ago .

propbank.arg: while his supporters may be cheering
from the man they elected just 18 months ago

roleset.note: TURN_AWAY-V NOTES: Similar to the "rotation" roleset for "turn" above (from turn.04-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: reject

example.name: turn_down-v: transitive
example.text: Separately , the Federal Energy Regulation Commission turned down for now a request by Northeast seeking approval of its possible purchase of PS of New Hampshire .

propbank.arg: a request by Northeast seeking approval of its possible purchase of PS of New Hampshire

roleset.note: TURN_DOWN-V NOTES: Compare this to the literal (non-phrasal) "turn down" (turn.01):John turned down the covers on the bed.In this case, "down" is the ArgM-DIR."Turn down" also occurs in the "transformation" roleset (turn.02) of the non-phrasal "turn":John turned the heat down. (from turn.05-v)

roleset.name: give, hand in

example.name: turn_in-v: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: He says , I 'm going to turn these pictures in to my superiors and they 're going to determine if it is fortune - telling .

roleset.note: TURN_IN-V NOTES: Essentially the same as "give" (from turn.06-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: surrender to authorities, as a criminal/rule violator

example.name: turn_in-v
example.text: Did the actual bombers turn themselves in or inform on themselves .

example.name: turn_in-v: with arg3
example.text: I mean Max would really be steamed if he thought his partner had turned him in on the armed robbery !

roleset.note: TURN_IN-V NOTES: Added by Julia, as this sense utilizes an argument not shared by turn_in.06

roleset.name: cause to be on

example.name: turn_on-v: tune in, turn on, drop out
example.text: But the genes were accompanied by a piece of DNA , called a promoter , that turns the genes on .

propbank.arg: a piece of DNA , called a promoter

roleset.note: TURN_ON-V NOTES: (from turn.13-v)

roleset.name: cause to be off

example.name: turn_off-v: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Protesters blocked roads across Yugoslavia and so many coal miners walked off the job , the government - run electric company may start to to turn off power .

roleset.note: TURN_OFF-V NOTES: (from turn.07-v)

roleset.name: cause to reject

example.name: turn_off-v: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: Is this a -- is this ten day suspension enough to turn them off to drugs / ?

roleset.note: TURN_OFF-V NOTES: (from turn.08-v)

roleset.name: cause to be off

example.name: turn_out-v: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Will the last ones out `` free market '' Virginia please turn out the lights on your way to North Carolina ?

propbank.arg: the last ones out `` free market '' Virginia
on your way to North Carolina

roleset.note: TURN_OUT-V NOTES: (from turn.09-v)

roleset.name: produce, create

example.name: turn_out-v: transitive
example.text: This factory turns out hundreds of mountain bikes every day .

roleset.note: TURN_OUT-V NOTES: The higher-numbered args (2 & 3) may or may not occur; here they arejust in case. (from turn.10-v)

roleset.name: seem

example.name: turn_out-v: ARG1
example.text: This master turned out to be corrupt and was put into a well for punishment , where he became a three - legged toad .

example.name: turn_out-v: split sentential arg
example.text: In last week 's rape case , for example , the girl turns out to have been a victim of incest .

propbank.arg: to have been a victim of incest

example.name: turn_out-v: with attribute
example.text: But in the end , everything turns out for the best , in the film makers ' warped view .

propbank.arg: in the film makers ' warped view

roleset.note: TURN_OUT-V NOTES: (from turn.11-v)

roleset.name: (cause to) turn out: appear, show up

example.name: turn_out-v: glitterati
example.text: Among the glitterati who [ ] turned out in bipartisan black - tie force to benefit the Coelho Epilepsy Fund last month were Sen. Robert Dole , Rep. Newt Gingrich , and other kingpins of Congress .

propbank.arg: to benefit the Coelho Epilepsy Fund

example.name: turn_out-v: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: John is this policy of trying to use the press as a whipping boy uh going to work to excite the conservative base and to turn voters out in the midterm elections / ?

roleset.note: TURN_OUT-V NOTES: (from turn.17-v)

roleset.name: submit, give, exchange

example.name: turn_over-v: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: Getting on in years , Yeh turned over day - to - day responsibility for the business to his hard - nosed second son Yeh Chui - jing a decade ago .

propbank.arg: day - to - day responsibility for the business
to his hard - nosed second son Yeh Chui - jing

example.name: turn_over-v: as exchange
example.text: Such is his reputation among the East Bay Bashers that when he hit his first career home run last season , the fan who caught it agreed to turn the ball over to him in return for an autograph .

roleset.note: TURN_OVER-V NOTES: Adding the arg3 to this makes sentences really awkward--only sportswriters would use it. (from turn.12-v)

roleset.name: (cause to) appear

example.name: turn_up-v: poof!
example.text: You never know where she 'll turn up .

example.name: turn_up-v: I said, 'poof'!
example.text: Though details were sketchy in the aftermath of the violent earthquake that shook the high - tech corridor along with the rest of the San Franciso Bay area , a spot check of computer makers turned up little , if any , potentially lingering damage to facilities or fabrication equipment .

propbank.arg: Though details were sketchy in the aftermath of the violent earthquake that shook the high - tech corridor along with the rest of the San Franciso
a spot check of computer makers
little , if any , potentially lingering damage to facilities or fabrication equipment

roleset.note: TURN_UP-V NOTES: (from turn.15-v)

roleset.name: cause to rotate exactly 180 degrees so that the front is facing what was the back

example.name: turn_around-n
example.text: Should I turn around ?

example.name: turn_around-n
example.text: The reforms turned the economy around .

roleset.note: TURN AROUND NOTES: Added for SpatialAMR.

roleset.name: spin for (probably) one or more complete rotations; give a twirl

example.name: turn_around-v
example.text: You should turn around so I can see your whole outfit

propbank.arg: so I can see your whole outfit

example.amr: (r / recommend-01 :ARG1 (t / turn-around-23 :ARG0 (y / you) :ARG1 y :purpose (p / possible-01 :ARG1 (s / see-01 :ARG0 (i / i) :ARG1 (o / outfit :mod (w / whole) :poss y)))))

roleset.note: TURN AROUND NOTES: Added for SpatialAMR.
